alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 7:46PM CST until February 18 at 8:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR JO DAVIESS...CARROLL...STEPHENSON...JACKSON AND EASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 745 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Monroe to near Andrew, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Freeport, Mount Carroll, Savanna, Lena, Bellevue, Stockton, Lanark, Warren, Preston, Hanover, Pearl City, Elizabeth, Shannon, Cedarville, Davis, Woodbine, Sabula, Chadwick and Dakota. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
